title: Net-GPT: LLM-Empowered Man-in-the-Middle Chatbot for UAVs
subtitle: Secure Communication via Fine-Tuned Language Models
description: LLM-based man-in-the-middle communication system for UAV networks, enabling intelligent message filtering, threat detection, and secure coordination. Published at EdgeSP 2023 (ACM EdgeSys Workshop).

body.title: Research Problem
paragraphs: UAV networks face sophisticated communication attacks including message spoofing, injection, and adversarial coordination that traditional rule-based filters fail to detect.
Existing security mechanisms lack contextual understanding of mission intent, making them unable to distinguish between legitimate tactical deviations and malicious commands.
Need for an intelligent intermediary that can understand natural language commands, assess threat levels, and make real-time decisions about message validity.

body.title: Technical Solution
paragraphs: Developed Net-GPT, a fine-tuned GPT-based language model that operates as an intelligent man-in-the-middle agent in UAV communication pipelines.
Collected and curated a specialized dataset of UAV commands, attack patterns, and security scenarios to fine-tune the model for threat detection and message validation.
Engineered a real-time inference pipeline that intercepts, analyzes, and filters UAV communication messages with minimal latency overhead, ensuring mission-critical operations remain responsive.
Implemented contextual reasoning capabilities that assess message validity based on mission state, sender identity, command semantics, and historical communication patterns.

body.title: Impact & Publication
paragraphs: Successfully detected and blocked sophisticated attack patterns including command injection, replay attacks, and adversarial coordination attempts that evaded traditional filters.
Maintained operational performance with minimal false positives, ensuring legitimate tactical commands pass through while blocking malicious messages.
Published at EdgeSP 2023 (3rd International Workshop on Edge Systems, Analytics and Networking) co-located with ACM EdgeSys.
Demonstrated the viability of LLM-based security layers for critical autonomous systems, opening new research directions in AI-powered network defense.
